item.title: Report E-2024090575
item.description:
Report E-2024090575

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-02T09:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-12
  • City: BURTON
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When preparing to transfer containers from rail car it was noticed that 2 of the containers were leaking from the seal at the back door of the box. Absorbent were then put under the leaking areas to contain the release and a response team was called in to address the release. The team needed extra equipment to handle the release and returned at 0830et. at 1015et the containers were removed from the rail car. The team the began adding absorbent to the boxes to absorb any free liquids. The door seals were fixed and the box doors were secured. The clean up was complete at 1530et.

item.title: Report E-2024090532
item.description:
Report E-2024090532

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: BATTLE CREEK
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 13, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3082 was punctured by a forklift and shipped, resulting in approximately ten (10) gallons of product being released to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the impacted site. SET personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the trailer. All impacted absorbents and the damaged drum were collected and containerized in one (1) 85-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090511
item.description:
Report E-2024090511

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-25T09:22:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-09
  • City: BURTON
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 9/9/24 rail car GIMX516236 arrived at the facility with 2 IBC containers that were found leaking material onto the rail car. Absorbent were put down and a crew was call out to address the release. The crew arrived and added containments pans under the area that was leaking and more absorbent was applied. The crew need more equipment and returned on 9/1/24 at 0900. They added more absorbents to the containers to absorb any free liquids that were left and addressed the container doors checking the seals and retightening them. The crew then cleaned the rail car and the outside of the boxes. They were completed and leaving the scene at 1630.
